page.title: 12THE PEOPLE OF FRANKLEY
page.content: Most of the people who moved to Frankley were young couples and so the area has a very high proportion of both young families and children compared with most areas in the country.Many of these are one parent families struggling to bring up children on their own.Many others have either one or both parents unemployed and are receiving state assistance.Of those employed the majority work in the car industry,especially at the local B.M.C.Austin/Rover plant in Longbridge.Others are also in factory or shop work.Because many parents are working,especially those on shift work many school children are alone at home or baby sit for younger offspring.They are expected at an early age to do housework,cooking and shopping.They are relied on heavily to help the family group.
